description: Integer part of geometric mean of first n natural numbers.
comments: a(n) < (n+1)/2 for n > 1 by the AM-GM (arithmetic-geometric mean) inequality.Also, largest integer m such that m^n <= n!. [From _M. F. Hasler_, Mar 07 2009]
references: Mohammad K. Azarian, AM - GM Strikes Again, Problem 451, College Mathematics Journal, Vol. 22, No. 3, May 1991, p. 255.  Solution published in Vol. 23, No. 3, May 1992, pp. 248-249.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,1000
formula: a(n) = floor((n!)^(1/n)); (n!)^(1/n) ~ e^(-1) (n+log(2 Pi n)/2) + O(log(n)^2/n) as n -> infinity.
prog: (PARI) A061375(n)=sqrtn(n!,n)\1 [From _M. F. Hasler_, Mar 07 2009](PARI) { default(realprecision, 100); f=1; for (n=1, 1000, f*=n; write("b061375.txt", n, " ", sqrtn(f, n)\1) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 22 2009]
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 02 2001
